theorem.caption: Condition for convergence to a number

info.caption: Warning
info.para: You may wonder if the converse of this proposition is also true: if \lim_{n\to \infty} a_n = 0, does the series \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_n converge to a number?
The answer is: ‘no’ and here is an example which demonstrates this.

statement.para:
If \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_n=L\in\RNr, then \lim_{n\to\infty}a_n = 0.
